name: Acidity regulator
description: A food additive, which controls the acidity or alkalinity of a food.

name: Anticaking agent
description: Reduces the tendency of particles of food to adhere to one another.

name: Antifoaming agent
description: A food additive, which prevents or reduces foaming.

name: Antioxidant
description: A food additive, which prolongs the shelf-life of foods by protecting against deterioration caused by oxidation.

name: Bleaching agent
description: A food additive (non-flour use) used to decolourize food. Bleaching agents do not include pigments.

name: Bulking agent
description: A food additive, which contributes to the bulk of a food without contributing significantly to its available energy value.

name: Carbonating agent
description: A food additive used to provide carbonation in a food.

name: Carrier
description: A food additive used to dissolve, dilute, disperse or otherwise physically modify a food additive or nutrient without altering its function (and without exerting any technological effect itself) in order to facilitate its handling, application or use of the food additive or nutrient.

name: Colour
description: A food additive, which adds or restores colour in a food.

name: Colour retention agent
description: A food additive, which stabilizes, retains or intensifies the colour of a food.

name: Emulsifier
description: A food additive, which forms or maintains a uniform emulsion of two or more phases in a food.
usedAs: density adjustment agent (flavouring oils in beverages)

name: Emulsifying salt
description: A food additive, which, in the manufacture of processed food, rearranges proteins in order to prevent fat separation.

name: Firming agent
description: A food additive, which makes or keeps tissues of fruit or vegetables firm and crisp, or interacts with gelling agents to produce or strengthen a gel.

name: Flavour enhancer
description: A food additive, which enhances the existing taste and/or odour of a food.

name: Flour treatment agent
description: A food additive, which is added to flour or dough to improve its baking quality or colour.

name: Foaming agent
description: A food additive, which makes it possible to form or maintain a uniform dispersion of a gaseous phase in a liquid or solid food.

name: Gelling agent
description: A food additive, which gives a food texture through formation of a gel.

name: Glazing agent
description: A food additive, which when applied to the external surface of a food, imparts a shiny appearance or provides a protective coating.

name: Humectant
description: A food additive, which prevents food from drying out by counteracting the effect of a dry atmosphere.

name: Packaging gas
description: A food additive gas, which is introduced into a container before, during or after filling with food with the intention to protect the food, for example, from oxidation or spoilage.

name: Preservative
description: A food additive, which prolongs the shelf-life of a food by protecting against deterioration caused by microorganisms.

name: Propellant
description: A food additive gas, which expels a food from a container.

name: Raising agent
description: A food additive or a combination of food additives, which liberate(s) gas and thereby increase(s) the volume of a dough or batter.

name: Sequestrant
description: A food additive, which controls the availability of a cation.

name: Stabilizer
description: A food additive, which makes it possible to maintain a uniform dispersion of two or more components.

name: Sweetener
description: A food additive (other than a mono- or disaccharide sugar), which imparts a sweet taste to a food.

name: Thickener
description: A food additive, which increases the viscosity of a food.
